edu.uci.calismall

Class CaliView

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.view.View
      • android.view.SurfaceView
        • edu.uci.calismall.CaliView
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Drawable.Callback, AccessibilityEventSource, KeyEvent.Callback, SurfaceHolder.Callback, JSONSerializable<CaliView>

    public class CaliView
extends SurfaceView
implements SurfaceHolder.Callback, JSONSerializable<CaliView>
    The SurfaceView on which the canvas is drawn.

    Drawing takes place within the drawView(Canvas) method, which is called roughly every Painter.SCREEN_REFRESH_TIME milliseconds by the Worker thread that is spawn by surfaceCreated(SurfaceHolder) (which in turn is called by the Android Runtime when the app is moved to the foreground).

    All data structures accessed by the drawing thread are only edited by the drawing thread itself to prevent conflicts (and therefore locking). When objects must be added to/removed from the view, they must be put to other data structures whose only purpose is to communicate with the drawing thread.

    Input (touch) events are handles by the onTouchEvent(MotionEvent) method, which is called by the Android Event Dispatcher Thread (or whatever they call it for Android, it's the equivalente of Java's good ol' EDT).

    To simplify code, and to avoid conflicts, all drawing operations are performed by the drawing thread (no postXYZ() calls), and all object creation/editing and border inclusion/intersection computation is done by the EDT.

    Author:
    Michele Bonazza

      The detector that handles all multi-touch events.

      The abstract radius (to be rescaled by scaleFactor) of landing zones for this device, meaning that it's rescaled to look the same physical size across devices.

      The current scale factor.

      The stroke used to select items.

      The current stroke.

      The maximum size that the area enclosed within a Stroke can reach while still being considered a tap.

      The minimum amount of pixels between two touch events (when events are closer to each other than this value only the first is considered).

      The delta X between the last center of the 2-fingers gesture and the current one.

      Whether a full redraw of the screen must be performed.

      Whether the view should display the "outside" of the canvas, meaning its non-drawable portion (in gray).

      Changes the current selected scrap to the argument temp scrap.

      Requests to clear (delete all objects from) this view and to empty every list.

      Takes a snapshot of this view and saves it to the argument file.

      Saves a JPEG thumbnail of this canvas to the argument file.
      void drawView(Canvas canvas)
      Draws this view to the argument Canvas.
      void fitZoom()
      Sets zooming and panning so that the drawable portion of the current canvas fits the width of the screen.
      void forceRedraw()
      Forces the drawing thread to perform a single redraw of the whole canvas using vector data (skipping the background bitmap redraw).
      CaliView fromJSON(JSONObject jsonData)
      Populates all fields in the argument newObject with data retrieved from jsonData.
      AmbilWarnaDialog getColorPicker()
      Returns a new color picker whose initial color is set to math the current stroke's.

      Returns a rectangle containing the current sketch's canvas width and height.

      Returns all strokes that may contain the rectangle.

      Returns a reference to the painter that is currently responsible for drawing this view.

      Returns the current canvas' scale factor.
      SpaceOccupationList<Scrap> getScrapList()
      Returns a reference to the list of all scraps lying within this view.
      Scrap getSelectedScrap(CaliSmallElement element)
      Returns the smallest scrap that contains the argument element, if any exists.
      Scrap getSelection()
      Returns a reference to the scrap that is currently selected.
      SpaceOccupationList<Stroke> getStrokeList()
      Returns a reference to the list of all strokes lying within this view.
      boolean hasChanged()
      Returns true if the content of this view changed since this method was last called (therefore this call has also the same effect as resetChangeCounter()).
      boolean isRunning()
      Returns whether the view is currently being drawn to a canvas.
      boolean onTouchEvent(MotionEvent event) 
      void printLog()
      Logs information about what's currently being shown on screen.
      void removeScrap(Scrap scrap)
      Removes (stops drawing) the argument scrap.
      void reset()
      Resets the state of this view.
      void resetChangeCounter()
      Resets the change counter, meaning that the hasChanged() will return true only if changes in this view took place after this method call.
      void setDrawableCanvas(RectF drawable)
      Sets the drawable portion of the canvas, the one with a white background.
      void setHighlighted(Scrap highlighted)
      Sets the argument scrap as highlighted, meaning that its border will be drawn on the foreground using a blueish background.
      void setPreviousSelection(Scrap previousSelection)
      Sets the previous selection.
      void setSelected(Scrap selected)
      Sets the argument scrap as the selected one, unselecting the scrap that was previously selected (if any was).

      Serializes this object to JSON format.

        public static final float CIRCLE_SWEEP_START
        The starting point for the sweep animation for long presses. 0 is the rightmost point, -90 is the topmost point.

        Constant Field Values

      • ABS_MAX_STROKE_DISTANCE_FOR_LONG_PRESS

        public static final float ABS_MAX_STROKE_DISTANCE_FOR_LONG_PRESS
        Absolute distance that the first and last point in a Stroke may have to be considered a valid target for long-presses scrap recognition (to be rescaled by scaleFactor). The value is squared to speed up comparison with Euclidean distances.
        See Also:

        public static final float LANDING_ZONE_RADIUS_TO_WIDTH_RATIO
        The ratio used to make the landing zone the same physical size regardless of the device that is currently being used.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PAINT

        public static final Paint PAINT
        The paint object that is used to draw all strokes with.

        Every Stroke stores values for how this Paint object should be modified before actually drawing it, including the stroke width, color and fill type. These are set in the Stroke.draw(Canvas, Paint) method for every stroke to be drawn.

      • LANDING_ZONE_PAINT

        public static final Paint LANDING_ZONE_PAINT
        The paint object that is used to draw landing zones with.

        The dotted effect is obtained by constantly updating the length of the segments according to the zoom level.

      • LONG_PRESS_CIRCLE_PAINT

        public static final Paint LONG_PRESS_CIRCLE_PAINT
        The paint object that is used to draw the circle animation whenever users press-and-hold in the proximity of a stroke.

      • DRAWABLE_PORTION_PAINT

        public static final Paint DRAWABLE_PORTION_PAINT
        The paint object that is used to draw the drawable portion of the canvas in white when the view is also showing a portion outside of the drawable area.

      • DRAWABLE_SHADOW_PAINT

        public static final Paint DRAWABLE_SHADOW_PAINT
        The paint object that is used to draw the shadow of the drawable portion of the canvas.

      • DRAWABLE_SHADOW_OFFSET

        public static final int DRAWABLE_SHADOW_OFFSET
        The offset applied to the drawable area's shadow, which is the same applied to the blur effect of said shadow.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • COMMITTER_REFRESH_PERIOD

        public static final long COMMITTER_REFRESH_PERIOD
        The amount of time that passes between two consecutive executions of the Committer.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DEFAULT_STROKE_THICKNESS

        public static final int DEFAULT_STROKE_THICKNESS
        The stroke thickness used by default.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • LONG_PRESS_CIRCLE_THICKNESS

        public static final int LONG_PRESS_CIRCLE_THICKNESS
        The stroke thickness in use when drawing the long press animation.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • drawableCanvas

        RectF drawableCanvas
        The portion of the canvas that represents paper, so it's colored white and users can draw on top of it.

      • drawableCanvasShadow

        RectF drawableCanvasShadow
        The area where the shadow of the drawable area will be drawn to (to simulate a piece of paper).

      • screenBounds

        RectF screenBounds
        A rectangle representing the screen boundaries translated to the current metrics (i.e. accounting for the current zoom level).

      • longPressCircleBounds

        RectF longPressCircleBounds
        The boundaries of the rectangle enclosing the circle that is shown on press-and-hold actions.

      • stroke

        Stroke stroke
        The current stroke.

        A stroke object is always available to be updated with the points that the user is touching. Every time a stroke ends (i.e. a MotionEvent.ACTION_UP is detected) a new empty one is created, ready to be filled with new points coming from the user drawing on the screen.

      • activeStroke

        Stroke activeStroke
        A reference to the current stroke used by the drawing thread.

        Points are added to the current stroke, but its path is drawn using this object instead, so that the Event thread can be decoupled from the drawing thread(s). In other words, the Event thread is free to change the value of the stroke field without risking to cause a ConcurrentModificationException, as it's not being directly used by the drawing thread (or by the committer thread).

      • selectionStroke

        Stroke selectionStroke
        The stroke used to select items.

        This stroke will most of the times be the same as activeStroke, but keeping a separate reference helps in dealing with corner cases.

      • matrix

        Matrix matrix
        The transformation matrix that is applied to the canvas, which stores all zooming and panning actions.

      • scaleDetector

        ScaleGestureDetector scaleDetector
        The detector that handles all multi-touch events.

      • actionStart

        long actionStart
        The instant at which the drawing of the current stroke started (in milliseconds after the Epoch).

      • scaleFactor

        float scaleFactor
        The current scale factor.

        All quantities must be divided by this scale factor in order to be scaled accordingly to the current zoom level.

      • dScaleFactor

        float dScaleFactor
        The current scale factor, in display coordinates.

        This is the instantaneous version of scaleFactor, in that this value is updated for every scale event, whereas scaleFactor stores the current zoom level, which is the combination of all dScaleFactor applied thus far.

      • dCenterX

        float dCenterX
        The X-center of a 2-fingers gesture, in display coordinates.

        Display coordinates don't take into account the current offset and zoom applied to the canvas.

      • dCenterY

        float dCenterY
        The Y-center of a 2-fingers gesture, in display coordinates.

        Display coordinates don't take into account the current offset and zoom applied to the canvas.

      • previousScaledCenterX

        float previousScaledCenterX
        The X-center of the last 2-fingers gesture.

      • previousScaledCenterY

        float previousScaledCenterY
        The Y-center of the last 2-fingers gesture.

      • translateX

        float translateX
        The delta X between the last center of the 2-fingers gesture and the current one.

        This is the instantaneous version of canvasOffsetX, in that this value is updated for every panning event, whereas canvasOffsetX is the sum of all translateX applied thus far.

      • translateY

        float translateY
        The delta Y between the last center of the 2-fingers gesture and the current one.

        This is the instantaneous version of canvasOffsetY, in that this value is updated for every panning event, whereas canvasOffsetY is the sum of all translateY applied thus far.

      • canvasOffsetX

        float canvasOffsetX
        The X-offset currently applied to the canvas, which is a result of all the panning actions executed by the user so far.

      • canvasOffsetY

        float canvasOffsetY
        The Y-offset currently applied to the canvas, which is a result of all the panning actions executed by the user so far.

      • scaledLandingZoneAbsRadius

        float scaledLandingZoneAbsRadius
        The abstract radius (to be rescaled by scaleFactor) of landing zones for this device, meaning that it's rescaled to look the same physical size across devices.

      • landingZoneRadius

        float landingZoneRadius
        The radius of the circle that represents the landing zone.

      • minPathLengthForLandingZone

        float minPathLengthForLandingZone
        The minimum length that a Stroke must reach before the landing zone is displayed over it (letting that Stroke be used to create a Scrap.Temp). The value is squared to speed up comparison with Euclidean distances.

      • landingZonePathOffset

        float landingZonePathOffset
        The offset at which the landing zone is shown, starting from the first point of the Stroke.

      • touchThreshold

        float touchThreshold
        The maximum size that the area enclosed within a Stroke can reach while still being considered a tap.

        Devices with high pixel density have a tendency to raise a lot of MotionEvent's, therefore no assumption can be made over when MotionEvent.ACTION_MOVE are generated: in other words, a tap is not only a sequence of MotionEvent.ACTION_DOWN followed by a MotionEvent.ACTION_UP with no MotionEvent.ACTION_MOVE in between, it's simply a stroke whose size falls within this threshold.

      • touchTolerance

        float touchTolerance
        The minimum amount of pixels between two touch events (when events are closer to each other than this value only the first is considered).

      • landingZoneCircleBoundsSize

        float landingZoneCircleBoundsSize
        The width/height of the rectangle enclosing the landing zone circle that is shown on long presses.

      • landingZoneCircleSweepAngle

        float landingZoneCircleSweepAngle
        The last angle that was used to draw the landing zone circle.

        This value is incremented for every draw event to draw the landing zone animation.

      • maxStrokeDistanceForLongPress

        float maxStrokeDistanceForLongPress
        The maximum distance that the first and last point in a Stroke may have to be considered a valid target for long-presses scrap recognition. The value is squared to speed up comparison with Euclidean distances.

      • currentAbsStrokeWidth

        int currentAbsStrokeWidth
        The stroke width chosen by the user.

      • scaleStrokeWithZoom

        boolean scaleStrokeWithZoom
        Whether stroke size should be rescaled according to the zoom level.

      • zooming

        boolean zooming
        Whether a full redraw of the screen must be performed.

      • forceSingleRedraw

        boolean forceSingleRedraw
        Whether a redraw has been requested.

      • bubbleMenu

        BubbleMenu bubbleMenu
        The current instance of the bubble menu.

      • zoomOutOfBounds

        boolean zoomOutOfBounds
        Whether the view should display the "outside" of the canvas, meaning its non-drawable portion (in gray).

    • Constructor Detail

      • CaliView

        public CaliView(CaliSmall c)
        Creates a new view for the argument CaliSmall instance.
        Parameters:
        c - the new CaliSmall instance

    • Method Detail

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets the state of this view.

      • drawView

        public void drawView(Canvas canvas)
        Draws this view to the argument Canvas.

        The current implementation simulates having a background bitmap on top of which foreground elements are drawn (current stroke, selections). The way it's done it's a little too fragile, changing the order of redrawing operations can trigger strobo-like effects, not cool (or very cool, depending on your taste). PorterModes should be used instead. Room for improvement!

        Parameters:
        canvas - the canvas onto which this view is to be drawn

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Requests to clear (delete all objects from) this view and to empty every list.

      • fitZoom

        public void fitZoom()
        Sets zooming and panning so that the drawable portion of the current canvas fits the width of the screen.

      • forceRedraw

        public void forceRedraw()
        Forces the drawing thread to perform a single redraw of the whole canvas using vector data (skipping the background bitmap redraw).

        This method is to be called whenever a full refresh of the screen must be performed because content is about to be edited. A full redraw of the screen takes more time than the bitmap background + vector foreground method, so this method should be called only when the background contains stale data that must be refreshed.

      • setSelected

        public void setSelected(Scrap selected)
        Sets the argument scrap as the selected one, unselecting the scrap that was previously selected (if any was).
        Parameters:
        selected - the scrap that should appear selected or null if there shouldn't be any scrap selected

      • setDrawableCanvas

        public void setDrawableCanvas(RectF drawable)
        Sets the drawable portion of the canvas, the one with a white background.

        The argument rect used only temporarily, as the view is not already been laid out and hence surfaceChanged(SurfaceHolder, int, int, int) has not been called. The first call will thus result in a larger canvas being displayed (since the display size computed from the Activity will always be larger than the view size because of the action bar), but as soon as the view gets notified of the availability of its Surface the actual size is used instead. This should happen within milliseconds, so users will never notice the issue.

        Parameters:
        drawable - the size of the drawable portion of the canvas

      • toggleEraserMode

        public void toggleEraserMode()
        Enables/disables the eraser mode.

      • setHighlighted

        public void setHighlighted(Scrap highlighted)
        Sets the argument scrap as highlighted, meaning that its border will be drawn on the foreground using a blueish background.
        Parameters:
        highlighted - the scrap to highlight

      • changeTempScrap

        public void changeTempScrap(Scrap newTempScrap)
        Changes the current selected scrap to the argument temp scrap.
        Parameters:
        newTempScrap - the new temporary scrap, cannot be null

      • addScrap

        public void addScrap(Scrap scrap,
            boolean addContent)
        Adds the argument scrap to the canvas.
        Parameters:
        scrap - the scrap to be added
        addContent - whether all of the strokes inside of the argument scrap should be added to the view as well, should be true only for newly created scrap copies

      • addStroke

        public void addStroke(Stroke stroke)
        Adds the argument stroke to the list of new strokes that must be added to the canvas.

        Since this method is only called by GhostStrokeHandler.onUp(PointF) when a ghost stroke is to be submitted to the canvas, if the argument stroke is the same as selectionStroke, this last field is reset. So, the message is: if you use this method passing it the selectionStroke, be aware that you're altering the selection.

        Parameters:
        stroke - the new stroke to be added

        the area onto which strokes can be drawn

      • setPreviousSelection
